meanings.definition: Of or relating to the act of touching or feeling with the hands.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used a palpatory approach to examine the patient's abdomen.
meanings.sent2: The palpatory nature of the fabric made it easy to determine its texture.
meanings.sent3: Feeling the softness of the blanket with a palpatory touch brought a sense of comfort.
meanings.sent4: Her palpatory exploration of the sculpture revealed its intricate details.
meanings.sent5: The palpatory sensation of the warm bread fresh from the oven was delightful.

meanings.definition: Capable of being perceived or detected by touch.
meanings.sent1: The rough surface was easily palpatory to anyone running their fingers over it.
meanings.sent2: The palpatory bumps on the surface indicated a need for repair.
meanings.sent3: The palpatory sensation of the cat's purring was soothing to the touch.
meanings.sent4: The palpatory presence of tension in the room was tangible.
meanings.sent5: The palpatory feedback from the piano keys guided her playing.
